ws.rocket.config

Interface ConfigModel.ConfigModelBuilder.BeanWriter<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of the configuration bean.
    All Superinterfaces:
    ConfigModel.ConfigModelBuilder.ValueWriter<T>
    Enclosing class:
    ConfigModel.ConfigModelBuilder<T>

    public static interface ConfigModel.ConfigModelBuilder.BeanWriter<T>
extends ConfigModel.ConfigModelBuilder.ValueWriter<T>
    Section writer factory contract to use when the section reader passes on a Map collection. This enables writing the gathered section data to multiple properties of a configuration bean, or the property type can be an object type that takes in the section data as constructor arguments.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ConfigModel.ConfigModelBuilder<T> storeInBeanOf(String propertyName, String... paramNames)
      The value as Map (containing data from configuration section) will be written to given bean property, which is a custom type that needs to be created by calling its constructor with given parameter names.
      ConfigModel.ConfigModelBuilder<T> storeInBeanProps(String... propertyNames)
      The value as Map (containing data from configuration section) will be written to given bean properties.

      • Methods inherited from interface ws.rocket.config.ConfigModel.ConfigModelBuilder.ValueWriter

        storeIn

    • Method Detail

      • storeInBeanProps

        ConfigModel.ConfigModelBuilder<T> storeInBeanProps(String... propertyNames)
        The value as Map (containing data from configuration section) will be written to given bean properties. The bean property names are expected to be contained in the map, or they will be skipped. Therefore, the bean property names and keys in the configuration section must be identical.

        The property names array may remain empty to let configuration handler attempt writing to bean properties by using all the keys in the map (failures will be logged as warnings). It is more risky but sometimes justified.

        Note: this kind of writing configuration settings only works when the Map contains keys and values as String objects. The keys must be String to match with bean property names. The values must be String so that value converter could convert them to target type, when necessary.

        Parameters:
        propertyNames - The property names (also the map keys) of the bean to write to. May be an empty array.
        Returns:
        Current configuration builder.

      • storeInBeanOf

        ConfigModel.ConfigModelBuilder<T> storeInBeanOf(String propertyName,
                                              String... paramNames)
        The value as Map (containing data from configuration section) will be written to given bean property, which is a custom type that needs to be created by calling its constructor with given parameter names. The property name must therefore refer to a setter method with a class type (not an interface nor an abstract class!) as parameter. The type must have preferably exactly one such constructor that takes the same amount of arguments as is the length of paramNames array.

        When resolving the values of these constructor arguments, the parameter names are looked up from the map of section configuration and converted to target type, which is the constructor argument type in the same position as the parameter name. However, when parameter names array is empty, the empty constructor will be called and the data read from the section will be ignored.

        Note: this kind of writing configuration settings only works when the Map contains keys and values as String objects. The keys must be String to match with parameter names. The values must be String so that value converter could convert them to target type, when necessary.

        Parameters:
        propertyName - The property name of the main configuration object.
        paramNames - The class constructor parameter names (also the map keys) for creating the value object for setting the property of the main configuration object. May be an empty array.
        Returns:
        Current configuration builder.
